trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CrossDomainMoveControl"></xref> class is used with a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.ModifyDNRequest"></xref> object to move an LDAP object from one domain to another.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CrossDomainMoveControl.#ctor"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CrossDomainMoveControl"></xref> class.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CrossDomainMoveControl.#ctor(System.String)"></xref> constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CrossDomainMoveControl"></xref> class using the specified target domain.
The DNS name of the destination domain controller.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CrossDomainMoveControl.GetValue"></xref> method returns the binary representation of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CrossDomainMoveControl"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.CrossDomainMoveControl.TargetDomainController"></xref> property gets or sets the DNS name of the destination domain controller (DC).
The DNS name of the destination DC.
